item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Dylan Thomas
♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind." -- Montaigne

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are the perfect entertainment: no commercials, no batteries, hours of enjoyment for each dollar spent. What I wonder is why everybody doesn't carry a book around for those inevitable dead spots in life." -- Stephen King

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Kate Morton
item.description: "The girl in the mirror caught my eye briefly...It is an uncanny feeling, that rare occasion when one catches a glimpse of oneself in repose. An unguarded moment, stripped of artifice, when one forgets to fool even oneself." -- Kate Morton

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Kate Morton
item.description: "But history is a faithless teller whose cruel recourse to hindsight makes fools of its actors." -- Kate Morton

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Kate Morton
item.description: "The Latter, I can tell, is added for my benefit. An assumption that the elderly cannot help but be impressed by the old fashioned." -- Kate Morton

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description:
"<b>Do not go gentle into that good night</b>
Do not go gentle into that good night, Old age should burn and rage at close of day; Rage, rage against the dying of the light. Though wise men at their end know dark is right, Because their words had forked no lightning they Do not go gentle into that good night.
Good men, the last wave by, crying how bright Their frail deeds might have danced in a green bay, Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
Wild men who caught and sang the sun in flight, And learn, too late, they grieved it on its way, Do not go gentle into that good night.
Grave men, near death, who see with blinding sight Blind eyes could blaze like meteors and be gay, Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
And you, my father, there on the sad height, Curse, bless me now with your fierce tears, I pray. Do not go gentle into that good night. Rage, rage against the dying of the light." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "Do not go gentle into that good night. Rage, rage against the dying of the light." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "And now, gentlemen, like your manners, I must leave you." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"Do you hate people?
I don't hate them...I just feel better when they're not around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "The problem with the world is that the intelligent people are full of doubts, while the stupid ones are full of confidence." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: ♥ Marlene♥ add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "Accept who you are. Unless you're a serial killer." -- Ellen DeGeneres
